title: Bere Island Walk Route

images.title: Neville Goodman / The Bere Island ferry
images.caption: The Bere Island ferry. There are two vehicle ferries to Bere Island. This is the westerly one, on its way back to Castletown Bearhaven.

images.title: Neville Goodman / Standing stone and Martello Tower
images.caption: Standing stone and Martello Tower

description: Bere Island is located in Bantry Bay off the Beara Peninsula in County Cork. It's a great place for walking with miles of trails and some stunning scenery to enjoy. You can catch the ferry from Castletownbere to reach the island. This walk around the island follows sections of the Beara Way, the Ardnakinna West Island Loop and the Rerrin Loop. These waymarked footpaths can be combined to create a fantastic long circular walk around the island. To continue your island walking in the area you could head to the nearby Dursey Island and pick up the Dursey Island Loop .
display_address: Derrycreveen West, Bear, West Cork, County Cork, Munster, P75 N973, Éire / Ireland
